content.description: Too many lines in the blowouts to describe every variation.  The one pictured here is on the far left side of the wall, just before the "trail" at the base of the wall heads up some stone steps.  The last good spot to get a nice sandy landing.  Match hands on a wide ledge.  Then go for a sharp cripper.  Left to the mono, then right to the jug.  I'm sure it could go up from here.  I'm scared of heights so that was it for me.
content.protection: Good sandy landing, although a crash pad wouldn't hurt.

content.description: Starting in the cave on the right side of the right side of the blowouts traverse out to large high pocket on left side of main bouldering area.  For first part use small ledge for feet and crimper moving to a sort of lie back (or into) with your left hand in a nice dish.  Use small crimper with right hand to transition body keeping feet high.  Move to an undercling with right hand then drop right knee placing on rock for greater support.  Follow obvious holds to the main pocketey part of the traverse (where traverse is generally started).  Continue traverse using high (easiest) middle (harder) or low (harder) finish.  Its fun stuff, you feel good when you complete it.
